    All Classes and Interfaces

    Class
    Description
    BackgroundPanel
     
    ControlPanel
    The ControlPanel class represents the control panel in the Labyrinth game interface.
    Direction
    The Direction enumeration defines the possible directions in the Labyrinth game.
    Game
    The Game class encapsulates the core logic of the Labyrinth game.
    GameBoard
    The GameBoard class represents the playing field in the Labyrinth game.
    GameBoardObserver
     
    GameBoardPanel
    GameBoardPanel is a JPanel that represents the game board visually in the GUI.
    GameController
    The GameController class serves as the controller in the MVC architecture for the Labyrinth game.
    GameDisplay
    GameDisplay is a JFrame that represents the main graphical interface for the game.
    ImageHelper
    Set of static functions allowing to manipulate images
    LabyrintheApp
    LabyrintheApp is the main entry point of the Labyrinthe game application.
    Objective
    The Objective class represents an objective in the game.
    ObjectiveComponent
    ObjectiveComponent is a JComponent that visually represents an objective in the game.
    Pawn
    The Pawn class represents a game pawn with an image path, its current position, and its starting position.
    Player
    The Player class represents a player in the game.
    PlayerObserver
     
    Position
    The Position class represents a coordinate in a two-dimensional grid.
    Tiles
    The Tiles class represents a tile in the Labyrinth game.
    TilesCorner
     
    TilesLinear
     
    TilesObserver
     
    TilesT
     
    TransparentJButton
    TransparentJButton is a subclass of JButton that creates a button with a transparent appearance, without borders or background.
    TransparentPanel
    TransparentPanel is a subclass of JPanel that creates a panel with a transparent background, allowing other components or backgrounds to show through.
    TuileComponent
    TuileComponent is a JComponent that represents a tile on the game board in the GUI.
    TuileFactory
    The TuileFactory class is responsible for creating instances of different tile types in the Labyrinth game.
